traceability.evidence: 1) src/cli-options.js & src/cli-options-helpers.js implement --prod-min-age, --dev-min-age, --prod-severity, --dev-severity parsing with validation and fallback to general flags. 2) src/config-loader.js reads nested "prod" and "dev" blocks from config file and enforces schema (minAge, minSeverity). 3) printOutdated (src/print-outdated.js) and its handlers (src/print-outdated-handlers.js) detect dependency type via loadPackageJson() and include a "Type" column (table) or "dependencyType"/"type" field (JSON/XML). 4) test/cli-options-helpers.test.js covers parsing and validation of all new flags. 5) test/cli.flags.test.js verifies default, fallback, and general --min-age/--severity behavior applies equally to prod/dev when no specific flags are given. 6) test/cli.config-file.test.js confirms config-file support for prod/dev overrides and CLI flags overriding config. 7) test/functional-assessment.test.js includes the 007.0 story and passes invalid & valid prod/dev age flag cases and checks that the output shows the dependency type. 8) test/printOutdated.prodDependency.test.js and test/printOutdated.json.test.js verify correct "prod"/"dev" labeling in table and JSON output. 9) A full Vitest run (150 tests) and manual smoke commands for --prod-severity and --dev-severity all pass.
traceability.notes: All acceptance criteria for story 007.0 (separate prod/dev thresholds) are implemented and fully covered by unit, integration, and end-to-end tests. CLI flags, config-file support, fallback & default logic, validation, dependency-type detection, output indication, and precedence rules are present and verified.
